comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: This is an interesting photograph. The young man in the centre is Captain Sir Daudi Chwa II, KCMG, KBE. He was Kabaka (King) of the Kingdom of Buganda from 1897 until 1939. He was the 34th Kabaka of Buganda. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daudi_Chwa_II_of_Buganda

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: The two men standing to the Kabaka's immediate right are almost certainly Ham Mukasa and Sir Apolo Kagwa (Kaggwa). Ham Mukasa was Sir Apolo Kagwa's secretary. Sir Apolo Kagwa was regent to the young Kabaka until he came of age. He was previously a prime minister [ Katikiro ] during the first Kabaka Mutesa's rule. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apolo_Kagwa

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: Extremely interesting. Thank you for drawing my attention to this image. Kagwa is also pictured in www.flickr.com/photos/nationalarchives/5408449132/

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: The National Archives are fantastic and so nice to see these images on flickr. I expect some of the European officials can probably be identified with a bit of digging too -it looks like a formal portrait to mark some occasion. My guess is that this must have been taken about 1901 and so the man with the moustache may be Sir Henry "Harry" Hamilton Johnston, GCMG, KCB en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Hamilton_Johnston I was born in Kenya in 1954 and was privileged to experience both the colonial and early post colonial aspect of life in that wonderful country and so have been particularly interested in the images here of East Africa

comment.author: 92943860@N00
comment._content: Wiki has a useful list of past Governors/Administrators of Uganda: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Uganda
